channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Notting Hill crash: Three dead after car hits block of flats and catches fire
item.description: Three people die after a car crashes into a block of flats and bursts into flames in Notting Hill.

item.title: M25 protests: Arrest tally over Insulate Britain action reaches 77
item.description: Police thank drivers for their "patience and understanding" during the disruption.

item.title: Nicholas Burton: 'Merciless' killer due to be released
item.description: Nicholas Burton was found guilty of stabbing 27-year-old Rachel McGrath to death in 1997.

item.title: Formula 1 fan arrested after being mistaken for mafia boss
item.description: Dutch police thought he was the head of the Sicilian mafia who has been on the run for decades.

item.title: Driver jailed for crash that killed teen passenger
item.description: Fahren Smith was behind the wheel of a car which had five passengers inside when it crashed.

item.title: Tyne Bridge's 'disgraceful' state emphasised by Great North Run
item.description: Sunday's half-marathon drew comments about the poor state of the Tyne Bridge, council leaders say.

item.title: Bristol police search fields after bodies found in house
item.description: Police have searched playing fields after the bodies of two men were found in a nearby house.

item.title: Emma Raducanu celebrated with Royal Mail postmark
item.description: The postmark congratulates the US Open Champion for "A First Class performance".

item.title: Steve Jagielka: Ex-Shrewsbury Town star's death was drug related
item.description: Steve Jagielka played more than 170 times for Shrewsbury Town between 1997 and 2003.

item.title: Stockport junction ludicrous and dangerous, says driving instructor
item.description: A junction with two give way markers close together is "dangerous", a driving instructor says.

item.title: Mooning Mona Lisa bronze statue on display in Bristol
item.description: The statue was made by a street artist after a challenge from Banksy.

item.title: The litter-laden alleyways transformed by residents
item.description: Residents decided to turn fly-tipping-laden alleyways into vibrant community spaces.

item.title: Coronavirus: Matlock Bath Illuminations return for 123rd year
item.description: The colourful event in Derbyshire sees hand-crafted boats parade along the River Derwent.

item.title: Suffolk school visited by Wattisham Airfield Apache helicopter
item.description: Pupils at Kersey Primary School are given a show and tell they will never forget.

item.title: Felixstowe arrival of largest container ship Ever Ace caught on drone
item.description: The aerial pictures show the Ever Ace coming in to dock at Felixstowe in Suffolk.

item.title: M25 climate protest: Aerials show long traffic queues as junctions blocked
item.description: Climate change protesters are demanding government action on home insulation.

item.title: Stonehenge: English Heritage to repair cracked lintels
item.description: The cracks and holes in the stone lintels of the 4,500-year-old stone circle are set to be repaired.

item.title: Banksy: Great Yarmouth council calls in conservator for removed mural
item.description: A council hopes to restore and relocate a piece covered amid "sensitivities" over a child's death.

item.title: Teesside TV and radio disruption warning amid mast work
item.description: The Eston Nab mast could be turned off up to 20 times for up to a minute at a time.

item.title: Man charged with killing Army veteran
item.description: The "adored father and grandfather" died in hospital a day after being attacked outside his home.

item.title: No sign of £4.8m golden toilet stolen from Blenheim Palace, two years on
item.description: The working 18-carat gold toilet called America was taken from Blenheim Palace.

item.title: Andy Murray: Emma Raducanu's US Open win 'very special', says three-time Grand Slam winner
item.description: Emma Raducanu's "very special" US Open win has gives British tennis with a "huge opportunity" to attract more people to the sport, says winner Andy Murray.

item.title: Andros Townsend: Mum made me believe again by sending me goals video
item.description: Andros Townsend credits his mum for the wonder strike which helps Everton beat Burnley and continues their unbeaten start to the season.

item.title: Ashes: England's plans unravel as Australia tour looms
item.description: On the back of their worst home summer since 1999, are England heading for a repeat of the hammering they took in Australia four years ago?

item.title: Lancashire beat Somerset to boost County Championship title hopes
item.description: Lancashire beat Somerset by 10 wickets at Taunton to move into serious County Championship title contention.
